channel.title: AAA Cards on Nancy's Creative Mess
channel.description: Recent content in AAA Cards on Nancy's Creative Mess

item.title: *AAACards #225*
item.description: It’s a 1 of 9 rectangles challenge at AAACards with the optional twist of gnomes… We’d love to see your cards where you use only one of the 9 rectangles found if you divide a rectangular card in 9ths. Be sure to keep it clean and simple and share it with us HERE! You KNEW I’d have to use the optional twist! I used a non-Christmas gnome stamp set but added a tiny holiday wish to it to make it a Christmas card.

item.title: *AAACards #224*
*AAACards #223*
item.description: It’s time for a no layer card challenge with AAACards… that’s right… just the card itself! The optional twist is to make it a sympathy card. Sympathy cards are not a card anyone wants to make… but they are necessary to have in our stash. I personally like to make my sympathy cards subdued… I was curious to see how the silver foil would look on grey cardstock so that’s what I played with for my challenge card.

item.title: *AAACards #222*
item.description: It’s a moodboard challenge at AAACards… you can take inspiration from any portion of the moodboard and create a clean and simple card to share with us! I simply chose the health care part of the moodboard and made a get well card with a sweet puppy. Card Info Images: Little Paper Shop Puppy Love; MFT Essential Sentiments Ink: Versafine Clair Nocturne; Memento Tuxedo Black; Copics Dies: MFT Stitched Rectangles

item.title: *AAACards #221*
item.description: It’s time for the first clean and simple challenge of August with AAACards. Our challenge for the next two weeks is “small and few” which means you should use a few small images on your card… the optional twist is (lady)bugs. The design team has some wonderful inspiration on the blog. We hope to see you playing along with us! I love ladybugs and they are so easy to colour for someone like me who doesn’t find colouring zen-inducing.

item.title: *AAACards #220*
item.description: It’s time for a new clean and simple challenge at AAA Cards! We want to see your cards with the design only along the edge (you can choose which edge) with the optional twist of “in the sea”. This was tough for me because I had two design team obligations that were a similar theme back to back! And the themes aren’t something I find easy to do in the first place!

item.title: *AAACards Challenge#219*
item.description: If it’s July, it must be Christmas in July season! AAACards has an anything CAS Christmas challenge for this week with the optional twist of pets. Pull your Christmas stash out of storage and play along with us HERE! You know I don’t enjoy colouring so I didn’t want to go out for my animal… so I chose this cute little birdie and coloured him up very simply. I love the mostly white card with just a hint of colour on the birdie.

item.title: *AAACards #218*
item.description: It’s time for a new clean and simple challenge at AAA Cards! We have a sketch for you this week with the added optional twist of flowers. Of course I did both (because I love florals!) Share your card with us HERE for a chance to be chosen as a guest designer in an upcoming challenge! I always struggle with the placement of things like the sketch shows so I wanted to do something different.

item.title: *AAACards #217*
item.description: Thanks for popping by today! I’m sharing with you, my card for the current clean and simple challenge at AAA Cards. We want you to use only 1 of the 9 rectangles on the front of your A2 card when you divide it up evenly (or 1/9 of any card size you like to use) with the optional twist of Butterflies. The 1/9th is the hard part for this card… I decided to use a little ink blending to create the rectangle to help me envision it… to create a little dimension, I used glue along the body of the butterfly and foam adhesive on the wings to make them pop up a bit

item.title: *AAACards #216*
item.description: It’s time for a new challenge at AAACards! AAA Cards is a clean and simple challenge blog that posts a new challenge every two weeks. We love to share our ideas on the cue cards and, more importantly, love to see what others come up with for our challenges! I sure hope you’ll play along and share your creations with us HERE! Let me explain our graphic a bit… for challenge #216, we want you to use the colours that you see in the graphic… and *optionally* we’d like to see a shaker card.

item.title: AAACards #215*
item.description: I’ve got a quick clean and simple card to share with you today with the new challenge at AAACards. You have two weeks to play along with us HERE for your chance to be chosen as a guest designer for an upcoming challenge. I had another idea in my head for this card but I can’t hold a pen well enough to actually colour at the moment, so I had to scrap that idea and come up with something else.

item.title: *Happy Birthday AAA Cards!*
item.description: AAACards is celebrating it’s 8th birthday!! We hope you’ll celebrate along with us by creating a clean and simple birthday card and sharing with us HERE. No birthday would be complete without presents so there are some prizes to be won as well! Head to the AAACards blog for all of the details! Someone posted about an easy interactive card idea that Jennifer McGuire did a video on… so I watched the video and decided to give it a try.

item.title: *AAACards #213*
item.description: It’s time for another clean and simple challenge with the team at AAACards. Our challenge for the next two weeks is “small and few” with the optional twist of Easter or Spring. I hope you’ll play along with us by sharing your clean and simple creations with us HERE! I did a quick and easy card thanks to this wonderful Lawn Fawn strip of flowers. I stamped them, coloured them quickly with a few spring colours of Copics, stamped my greeting and then put the flowers on the card with some foam adhesive.

item.title: *AAA Cards #212*
item.description: It’s time for a new challenge with the team at AAA Cards… we are a clean and simple challenge blog with challenges every two weeks. For our current challenge, we want to see your clean and simple cards that are decorated “along the edge” with the optional twist of “your country”. Share your creations with us HERE for your chance to be chosen as a guest designer for an upcoming challenge!
